translation.en: Hello?
-Terry? - [Terry] What?
[woman] Dr. Satmani's office is on the line.
-Want me to get on too? -Yes.
All right.
[Terry] Hi, doctor.
Oh, my cousin, yes.
[woman stammers] This is her cousin talking.
The tremor seems to be about the way it was to begin with.
translation.ko: 일단 오른팔이 떨리는 게 전이랑 비슷해요

translation.en: [Terry] No. It's not the way it was to begin with. It's slightly better.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 전이랑은 달라요 그보단 좀 나아요

translation.en: -Okay. We'll do that. -Okay, Laura.
Thanks for calling, Laura.
-Thank you. -Okay, bye.
Bye-bye.
I got a tremor in this right arm, and it bugs the heck out of me.
translation.ko: 오른팔이 자꾸만 떨려서 여간 신경 쓰이는 게 아니에요

translation.en: We've never had health problems before.
translation.ko: 전에는 건강 문제로 걱정한 적이 한 번도 없었는데

translation.en: All of a sudden, we have.
I think we're getting to the point in our lives we've got to make a decision.
translation.ko: 인생에서 결단을 내려야 할 시점이 온 것 같아요

translation.en: Nope, not yet.
[Pat VO] I think we have to give our house up now. There's too much...
translation.ko: 이제 테리의 집을 포기해야 한다고 봐요, 이 집엔...

translation.en: too much to maintain, really, with it.
We're of an age where I think we're going to have to get rid of it and sell.
translation.ko: 이 나이가 되면... 집은 정리하고 팔아야죠

translation.en: [Terry] This would be a big, big move for us.
And where we go, I'm not sure.
It has to be a decision that we both agree on.
translation.ko: 우리 둘 다 동의할 수 있는 결정을 내려야겠죠

translation.en: I think we're all set, y'all.
We're going to Edmonton.
The family said that there were some really attractive places up there,
translation.ko: 거기 사는 친척들이 그러는데 굉장히 좋은 곳이 많대요

translation.en: and perhaps we'd be interested in trying to come back there to live.
I'm not pleased about being in the frozen north, I can tell you.
translation.ko: 추운 북쪽에서 사는 건 솔직히 별로지만요

translation.en: I don't care where we go.
As long as we're together, we'll be happy.
-[woman] Auntie Terry has been our rock. -[Terry] Yes.
[woman] And you might've lived far away,
but you were always our rock.
-[man] Yep. -You've been my rock
since the day you were born.
[woman] Yeah, it's true.
-If you need us for anything, you ask us. -[woman] That's why we're all here.
translation.ko: 필요한 거 있으면 뭐든 말씀하세요 우리가 여기 왜 왔는데요

translation.en: Just to make sure that you have a good place to stay
translation.ko: 두 분이 편히 머물 곳을 찾고

translation.en: and that you make the decision that fits you guys.
translation.ko: 최선의 선택을 하도록 도우러 온 거예요

translation.en: We're gonna try to figure out the answers.
-[woman] Yeah, you betcha. -Yeah.
And so far, we don't know what the answer is.
[woman] They've been in my life since day one.
translation.ko: 두 분은 태어날 때부터 쭉 저를 봐 오셨죠

translation.en: I was 13. You were 11.
And they've always been Auntie Terry and Auntie Pat.
translation.ko: "다이애나 볼란 테리의 조카" 테리 고모랑 팻 아줌마는 늘 함께였어요

translation.en: [Diana] Auntie Terry has always been a constant in my life.
translation.ko: 테리 고모는 한결같이 저를 지켜봐 주셨어요

translation.en: She's always been the one that was there for me.
She's always been the one who looked out for me
translation.ko: 살면서 별의별 난리를 다 겪는 동안

translation.en: in the midst of all the chaos we lived in.
Auntie Terry and I have this amazing relationship.
It's like she's my mother.
So there's this tremendous bond between Auntie Terry and me.
translation.ko: 테리 고모랑 제 사이에는 엄청나게 끈끈한 유대감이 있죠

translation.en: [Terry] I love the other kids,
but Diana is special.
She's like the daughter I never had.
[Diana] It was her that made the difference in my life.
translation.ko: 고모가 제 삶을 다르게 만들어 주셨어요

translation.en: She was there when I was baptized. She was there when I graduated.
translation.ko: 제가 세례를 받을 때도 학교를 졸업할 때도 같이 계셨고

translation.en: She sent me to university.
She was the one who heard me when I said I wanted to be a teacher.
translation.ko: 교사가 되고 싶다고 했을 때도 진지하게 들어주셨고요

translation.en: I would never have what I have today without her, ever.
translation.ko: 고모가 아니었다면 지금처럼 살 수 없었을 거예요

translation.en: So I owe everything to her...
translation.ko: 결국... 전부 다 테리 고모 덕분이죠

translation.en: and only her.
Didn't know they were gay till three years ago.
translation.ko: 두 분이 동성애자인 건 3년 전에 처음 알았어요

translation.en: [Terry] I felt like I was sort of living a lie,
so I said to Pat,
"The next time Diana comes down, I'm gonna tell her."
She came down, and I was really nervous.
I could see that she was not herself,
and I couldn't understand what was going on.
And I saw Pat say to Terry,
translation.ko: 근데 팻 아줌마가 테리 고모한테 이러더라고요

translation.en: "You have to tell her before dessert."
We had a lovely dinner and still hadn't told her,
translation.ko: 분위기 좋게 저녁을 먹으면서도 그 애한테 말을 못 했어요

translation.en: and I was getting more nervous because I didn't want to lose her love.
translation.ko: 갈수록 불안해지더라고요 그 애의 사랑을 잃을까 봐서요

translation.en: So Pat said, "Well, you better tell her."
So I came back in with dessert,
and I said, "Diana, I got something to tell ya.
translation.ko: 그 애한테 말했죠 '다이애나, 할 말이 있어'

translation.en: We're gay."
[Diana] She was just shaking, and she started to cry.
And I went and put my arms around her, and I said,
"I don't care."
[Terry] She was wonderful.
And I said, "You can go back home and tell the other kids if you want.
translation.ko: 돌아가서 다른 형제들한테 말해도 된다고 해줬어요

translation.en: I don't care.
But you were the one I wanted to know."
Now you can tell your stories.
translation.ko: 이제 마음 놓고 다 말씀하셔도 돼요

translation.en: [Terry] So since that day, it seems like a great big thing
had been lifted off my shoulders.
[man] Terry, how long have you been together? Sixty-eight years?
translation.ko: 두 분이 함께한 지 얼마나 됐죠? 68년인가요?

translation.en: -Sixty-five and a half. Plus. -[man] Sixty-five and a half years.
You weren't shocked when I told you?
[man] No. I never thought about it. I looked...
translation.ko: 아니, 그렇게 생각해 본 적은 한 번도 없긴 하지만...

translation.en: Terry was such a role model to me. It never even dawned on me.
translation.ko: 테리 고모는 내 롤 모델이라 상상도 못 했어 "킴 도너휴 다이애나의 동생, 테리의 조카"

translation.en: -I didn't really care, really. -No.
-[Kim] I love them so much-- -[woman] It didn't matter.
translation.ko: - 두 분을 정말 사랑하고... - 그런 건 안 중요해

translation.en: [Kim] I didn't want nothing to change, and I didn't really care.
translation.ko: 전이랑 달라지는 건 싫었거든 난 아무래도 괜찮았어

translation.en: Terry, I was brought up by a drunken homophobic, cheating...
translation.ko: 고모도 알다시피 아버지는 술꾼에 동성애 혐오자, 사기꾼이었고

translation.en: He instilled it in me that it was really bad.
[Diana] Her brother, Tom, my father, used to say,
translation.ko: 테리 고모의 오빠이자 제 아빠였던 톰은 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: "She needs to be fucked by a big black guy...
translation.ko: '그 애는 덩치 큰 흑인 남자가 한번 박아줘야 해'

translation.en: set her straight."
He used to say that all the time. Sober, not drunk.
translation.ko: 입버릇처럼 말했죠 취한 것도 아니고 맨정신으로요

translation.en: So I went to Terry, and I said, "He said that you're a lesbian."
And she looked at me and said, "We're not.
Living in the States is expensive, and we're just really good friends,
translation.ko: '미국은 생활비가 많이 들잖니' '팻이랑은 워낙 친해서 같이 사는 거야'

translation.en: and we live together."
And I never thought anything more of it because that's what she said.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 다른 생각은 안 했어요 고모가 아니라면 아닌 거죠

translation.en: ♪ Once, I had a secret love ♪
♪ That lived ♪ ♪ Within the heart of me ♪
♪ All too soon, my secret love ♪
♪ Became impatient to be free ♪
♪ Now, I shout it ♪
♪ From the highest hills ♪
♪ Even told ♪
♪ The golden daffodils ♪
♪ At last ♪
♪ My heart's an open door ♪
♪ And my secret love's no secret ♪
translation.ko: 그리고 내 비밀스러운 사랑은 더는 비밀이 아니라네

translation.en: ♪ Anymore ♪
[woman] I have to tell you. When I found out, I was shocked.
translation.ko: 처음 알았을 땐 정말 깜짝 놀랐어요

translation.en: I was shocked.
I love my Aunt Terry.
translation.ko: "로지 도너휴 1899-2001 테리 도너휴 1925, 팻 헨셜 1928" 테리 고모를 정말 좋아해요 그래서 약간 배신감이 들었죠

translation.en: It's just I feel a bit betrayed that she couldn't have told us sooner.
translation.ko: 테리 고모를 정말 좋아해요 그래서 약간 배신감이 들었죠 우리한테 더 빨리 말 안 해줘서요

translation.en: I mean, we've all done things,
but have we lived a lie for how many years?
translation.ko: 어떻게 그 긴 세월을 속이며 살 수 있죠? "태미 도너휴 다이애나의 자매, 테리의 조카"

translation.en: Sixty-some years. Like...
But now staring at this now, and this is 2001 when Grandma Rosie died,
translation.ko: 근데 지금 여기를 보니 알겠어요 2001년, 로지 할머니가 돌아가시고

translation.en: Terry and Pat, they put their names on there.
translation.ko: 테리와 팻이 여기에다 두 사람 이름을 새겼거든요

translation.en: Grandma Rosie confided in me.
She called them the girls, the girls.
You know, living together in Chicago because it's safe to be together,
translation.ko: 둘이 시카고에서 같이 사는 건 그게 안전하기 때문이고

translation.en: she figured Auntie Terry would meet somebody still and get married.
translation.ko: 고모도 언젠간 남자를 만나 결혼할 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: So, Grandma had no idea.
Hearing that my aunt's a lesbian is hard for me.
I can't imagine my grandmother. She wouldn't have understood.
translation.ko: 할머니가 얼마나 속상했을까 싶어서요 용납 못 했을 거예요

translation.en: [Terry] My mother wouldn't have understood.
translation.ko: 어머니는 절대로 이해 못 했을 거예요

translation.en: She probably would've disowned me.
Dad and I talked a lot.
I'd come home from ball season
and bring him a bottle of booze from the States,
translation.ko: 미국에서 산 술을 한 병 드리고

translation.en: and we'd have a little party, him and I.
And I had a lot of good times with him.
And I think he knew.
But Dad was a very understanding man.
I love my mother, but she wasn't as understanding as Dad.
translation.ko: 어머니를 사랑하지만 아빠만큼 이해심이 깊진 않았어요

translation.en: And Dad liked Pat very much.
And he told me, "I'd rather see you this way than married to someone
who would mistreat you."
I don't know. When I think of my dad, I cry.
translation.ko: 어째서인지 아빠 생각을 하면 자꾸 눈물이 나요

translation.en: He was such a good guy.
[Tammy] Who I'd like to see be buried here is her husband, Jack.
translation.ko: 할머니 곁에 묻혀야 할 분이 또 있어요 할아버지인 잭요

translation.en: Terry and Pat should be together.
I'm not questioning that,
but Grandpa should be here with Rosie...
translation.ko: 대신 할아버지도 로지 할머니와 함께 있어야 해요

translation.en: 'cause he's out there all by himself.
And now I understand. They-- They-- All these years they've been together,
translation.ko: 이제는 알겠어요 여태 쭉 사랑하는 사이였으면서 우리한테는 비밀로 해온 거죠

translation.en: and they've hid this secret from us, but they should get married.
translation.ko: 여태 쭉 사랑하는 사이였으면서 우리한테는 비밀로 해온 거죠 근데 결혼은 해야 해요

translation.en: Living in sin is not a good thing.
[Diana] You're gonna have a good afternoon. You're gonna like this place.
translation.ko: 오후 시간에 소일거리도 많고 거기를 좋아하시게 될 거예요

translation.en: You think we'll like it better than that first one we saw?
translation.ko: 처음 본 곳보다 거기가 나은 것 같니?

translation.en: [Diana] Um, well, I don't know.
Depends on what they have to offer, and I think it's all about support now.
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 주는 혜택에 따라 다르죠 두 분을 잘 지원하는 게 중요해요

translation.en: It's all about making sure that you're cared for
translation.ko: 두 분 마음에 드시는지 부족함이 없도록 보살필 곳인지

translation.en: and that you get the care that you deserve.
-[Terry] Right. -If something happens to one of you,
translation.ko: - 맞아 - 둘 중 한 분께 무슨 일이 생기면

translation.en: we got to make sure the other one's got support.
translation.ko: 다른 분이 도움을 받을 수 있어야 하잖아요

translation.en: Whatever it costs.
[Terry] What if I live to be 106 like Grandma?
[Diana] Then you can count on me to carry you.
translation.ko: 그럼 제가 모실 테니 저만 믿으세요

translation.en: -[Pat chuckles] -[Diana] I'll do it.
[Pat] So far, I don't have any feelings about Edmonton...
except for you.
[Pat] You know, that's different.
[Diana VO] Auntie Pat has been there.
She's been good to me.
If you wanna move here...
[Diana VO] I still don't know... whether she's good to me
translation.ko: 하지만 저한테 왜 잘해주는지는 아직도 모르겠어요

translation.en: because she thinks she has to because of the way Auntie Terry feels about me,
translation.ko: 테리 고모가 워낙 절 아끼니까 의무감에 잘해주는 건지

translation.en: or whether she's good to me because she really wants to be.
translation.ko: 아니면 자기가 진짜 좋아서 잘해주는 건지 헛갈려요

translation.en: And I mean, that's just the way I feel about her.
translation.ko: 팻을 생각하면 그런 기분이에요 늘 그랬었죠

translation.en: I've always felt that way. It doesn't feel genuine for me.
translation.ko: 팻을 생각하면 그런 기분이에요 늘 그랬었죠 진심이 느껴지지 않아요

translation.en: It doesn't feel real for me.
It feels contrived on both sides.
translation.ko: 양쪽 다 감정을 꾸며내는 것 같아요

translation.en: This is going to open up a whole new life for ya.
translation.ko: 두 분에겐 완전히 새로운 삶이 시작될 거예요

translation.en: I hope I like it. [chuckles]
[Diana VO] Pat won't let me in and just accept the fact that I'm there.
translation.ko: 팻은 제 존재를 인정할 뿐 저한테 마음을 열진 않을 거예요

translation.en: It's always been this competition.
And just a shade, but not by much.
translation.ko: 색깔이 좀 다르지만 차이는 크지 않아요

translation.en: [Diana VO] I think we're both playing a game.
My whole life-work balance thing would be out of whack.
translation.ko: 제 일과 삶 사이의 균형이 다 망가질 거예요

translation.en: [Diana VO] I think we're both playing a game because of Auntie Terry.
This is our standard one-bedroom, and it has a balcony.
translation.ko: 이게 저희 일반적인 침실 1개 타입이에요 발코니도 있어요

translation.en: [Terry] You know, for a one-bedroom, this is very nice.
[Diana] Actually, it really is.
-Room for everything, or not quite? -No. Mmm. Not quite.
So on our way, this is our hair salon. And we're going right here.
translation.ko: 가는 길에 미용실도 있고요 이쪽으로 오세요

translation.en: We have not had any same-sex couples, but we do have family members that are.
translation.ko: 동성 커플은 한 번도 없었고 동성인 가족분들은 계세요

translation.en: But no residents per se, not as yet.
[Terry] If there was, would they be accepted?
I believe so.
I don't know if you got a sense of our community,
but everywhere we go, they say hello.
It's all about people.
It's about who you are than your orientation.
Okay.
-Because we are a couple. -[woman] Mm-hmm.
I think that's wonderful.
And we're a couple of many, many, many, many years.
-[Diana] Tell how many. -[woman] How many years?
Sixty-five and a half.
[woman] So you were pioneers in a time when it wasn't popular?
-[Terry] That's right. -[Pat] Exactly. In the '40s.
[woman] I think it's a wonderful thing.
[Diana] What have you got available right now?
translation.ko: 지금 입주 가능한 방은 어떤 게 있죠?

translation.en: [woman] I have a one-bedroom. That's it.
-I don't want a one-bedroom-- -[woman] Everything is on the wait list.
translation.ko: - 그건 싫어요 - 나머지는 다 대기자가 있죠

translation.en: One-bedroom's too small. See, we have to sell a house...
translation.ko: 침실 하나는 너무 좁아요 - 집을 팔아야 하거든요 - 그렇군요

translation.en: -[woman] Yes. -...which could take some while.
translation.ko: - 집을 팔아야 하거든요 - 그렇군요 시간이 좀 걸릴 거예요

translation.en: -[woman] How is the market right now? -Not very good.
[Pat] Not very good.
[Diana VO] Auntie Pat's throwing up roadblocks all over the place.
I think that... that... that she doesn't want to come here
because then Auntie Terry will have someone else in her life besides Pat.
translation.ko: 테리 고모의 삶에 자기 외에 다른 사람이 생기게 되니까요

translation.en: She's never had to share Auntie Terry with anybody.
translation.ko: 지금까진 혼자서만 테리 고모를 독차지할 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Tammy] There's Grandma Rosie.
-[Terry] Yeah. -[Tammy] There's Brian and Diana.
[Tammy VO] Our family is a good family.
We are there for each other,
but my take on this,
Pat has kept Terry away.
[Tammy] Here's grandpa and Paul.
[Pat] Beautiful.
[Tammy VO] I believe that Terry would've been around her family if it hadn't been for Pat.
translation.ko: 팻이 아니었다면 테리 고모는 가족들과 더 가까이 지냈을 거예요

translation.en: So maybe that's where the root of the contention is,
is that Pat stole her away somehow.
translation.ko: 팻이 테리를 우리 가족에게서 빼앗아 간 거요

translation.en: [Terry] Seventy. Gee.
Everybody loves Terry.
They'll put up with me only because of Terry, I think.
translation.ko: 테리를 봐서 내 존재를 참고 견디는 거죠

translation.en: They'll put up with me.
So there you go.
[Terry] Happy New Year!
Happy New Year!
[man] Come on in out of the cold.
-Good to see you guys. -Hi, Terry. Come on in.
translation.ko: - 다시 보니 좋네 - 테리, 어서 와

translation.en: -Hi, Jack. How you doing? -[Pat] How are you, darling?
[Jack] I'm great. How are you?
Yeah, how are you?
-Good. -Hey, Jack.
Good to see you.
-Nice to see you. -Come on in. I'll take your coats.
translation.ko: - 나도 반가워 - 들어와, 코트는 나 주고

translation.en: I will take your drink orders. Are you having scotch?
I want to have some scotch and water.
-Scotch and water. -Please.
I'll have a very weak scotch.
A weak scotch.
-With water. -Okay.
[Pat] But you know the family is there, and we love them dearly.
translation.ko: 그쪽에 조카들이 살잖아 우리가 걔들을 참 좋아해

translation.en: [Jack] I know it.
You know, they want us to go back there to live.
translation.ko: 걔들은 우리가 그쪽으로 옮겨서 살길 바라고 있어

translation.en: I think Edmonton's a lovely city, but my heart's not in it.
translation.ko: 에드먼턴은 아름다운 도시지만 난 정이 안 가더라고

translation.en: Yeah.
It's too cold.
Are you thinking about moving to a warm climate then?
translation.ko: 그럼 더 따뜻한 데로 옮기려고? "존 버드"

translation.en: Well, you know what? If you'd come along.
[John] I'm available for travel.
[Pat] It's difficult to leave your friends.
-Of course it is. -You know that.
I know it. I know.
[Pat] Remember we'd have these big parties?
[Jack] Oh, my God. Yeah.
[Pat] My goodness sakes.
Friends are...
Well, they're everything, really.
Many times, friends are... closer than family.
translation.ko: 친구들이 가족보다 더 친할 때도 많고요

translation.en: -[John] Here's yours. -Thank you. My gosh, this looks great.
[Jack] It's a down-home dinner.
[Terry] Thank goodness that we met you guys.
-Here's to you, Jack. -Still two guys from Chicago.
translation.ko: - 친구를 위하여 - 시카고의 두 남자를 위해

translation.en: -Yeah. -Oh, the best. The best.
You gals came in the '50s or '60s?
[Terry] Yeah, I came down in '46 and played four years professional.
[Jack] Okay. [Pat] I came down to live in July of 1950.
[Terry] But for a while, we really didn't care to meet anybody.
translation.ko: 한동안은 다른 사람들을 만날 마음이 없었어

translation.en: We were so happy to be alone and away from Canada.
translation.ko: 캐나다를 벗어나 둘이 있게 된 것만으로 행복했거든

translation.en: [Terry] In the '40s, you had to be very careful.
[Jack] Well, we had to be so careful in the late '50s and early '60s.
[Terry] Yeah.
-[Pat] Yes, absolutely. -[Jack] Terrible.
[male announcer] Two out of three Americans look upon homosexuals
translation.ko: 미국인 셋 중 두 명은 동성애를

translation.en: with disgust, discomfort, or fear.
[man] There may be some in this auditorium.
There may some girls that'll turn lesbian.
translation.ko: "존 소렌슨 형사, 플로리다주 데이드 카운티 풍기 및 청소년 팀" 이 중 몇몇 여성은 레즈비언이 될 수도 있죠, 누가 압니까

translation.en: We don't know.
translation.ko: 이 중 몇몇 여성은 레즈비언이 될 수도 있죠, 누가 압니까

translation.en: One out of three of you will turn queer.
translation.ko: 여러분 셋 중 하나는 퀴어가 될 겁니다

translation.en: And you will be caught.
Don't think you won't be caught,
translation.ko: 피할 수 있을 거라 생각하지 마세요

translation.en: and the rest of your life will be a living hell.
translation.ko: 잡히면 남은 인생은 생지옥이 될 줄 알아요

translation.en: [male announcer] The homosexual responds by going underground.
translation.ko: 동성애자들은 정체를 숨기는 것으로 대응하고 있습니다

translation.en: [woman 1] Those were the days where bars that were suspected of being lesbian bars
were frequently raided, and if women didn't have on,
translation.ko: 자주 불시 단속을 당했고 여성 의류 아이템 중에서

translation.en: I think it was three articles of women's clothing,
translation.ko: 세 가지 이상 착용하지 않으면 체포, 구금당하기도 했어요

translation.en: they could be arrested and thrown in jail.
translation.ko: "이본느 집터, 작가 시카고 대학 출판부 원고 편집자"

translation.en: So it was not an easy time to be out.
[woman 2] If you went to the bars, they would check you with a flashlight,
translation.ko: "경찰, 27일간의 풍기 단속 기간 중 23명 체포" 술집에 가면 경찰이 손전등으로 검사했어요

translation.en: and as you came out of the bar, if you had fly-front pants on,
translation.ko: 술집에서 나오는데 "마지 서밋, 활동가 '히스 앤 허스' 바 전 소유주"

translation.en: you went in the paddy wagon.
translation.ko: 앞으로 여미는 바지를 입고 있으면 경찰차에 태웠죠

translation.en: You were impersonating a man.
♪ This time ♪
translation.ko: "심야 호숫가 단속으로 90명 체포 남성 89명, 여성 14명 구금"

translation.en: [Marge] I never got caught in any of the raids. I jumped out windows and ran like hell.
translation.ko: 전 단속에 걸린 적이 없어요 창문에서 점프해 미친 듯이 달렸죠

translation.en: I thank the people of Chicago for their vote of confidence in my public record.
translation.ko: 제 공무 기록을 믿고 투표해 주신 시카고 시민들께 감사드립니다

translation.en: [Marge] Old man Daley...
put a lot of my friends out of work
translation.ko: 실업자 신세가 된 친구들이 한둘이 아니었어요

translation.en: because they printed everybody's name and what they did for a living.
Teachers and professors and principals in schools,
they lost their jobs.
[woman] There are many stories about people losing their jobs and committing suicide.
translation.ko: 실직하고 자살한 사람들 얘기도 흔히 들을 수 있었죠

translation.en: Some of them lost custody of children.
translation.ko: 자녀의 양육권을 잃은 사람도 있고요 "트레이시 베임 신문 발행인 겸 작가"

translation.en: Certainly, divorces, all sorts of things happened
as a ramification of the bar raids.
translation.ko: 술집 단속의 여파로 별일이 다 일어났죠

translation.en: [Terry] We never went to those bars.
translation.ko: 우린 절대로 그런 술집에 안 갔어

translation.en: [Pat] We never went to a bar.
[Terry] We didn't want to be sent back to Canada.
They had a raid.
[John] Oh, sure.
[Jack] You gals were immigrants.
[Terry] Yeah.
[Jack] So you couldn't afford to screw up.
translation.ko: 그러니 더 말썽에 휘말려선 안 됐지

translation.en: [Pat] We have-- We have a green card.
[John] I think parties are the main place that people met each other.
[Terry] Yeah. I remember going to these parties.
translation.ko: 맞아, 나도 그런 파티에 갔던 생각이 나

translation.en: We'd all, us girls, would get in there, and we'd dance up a storm.
translation.ko: 우리 여자들은 파티에 가면 신나게 춤을 춰댔어

translation.en: [John] The only time you let your hair down is when... [John and Jack] ...you went out.
translation.ko: 그런 자리에서나 마음 놓고 행동할 수 있었지

translation.en: [John] And you were with your own.
[Pat] Have you guys thought about getting married?
translation.ko: 결혼하는 거 생각해 본 적 있어?

translation.en: -[John] No. -[Jack] Yeah. I have.
-I have, but he... -[John] To whom?
-[Terry laughs] -To you.
[John] Hey, that's something you haven't told me.
translation.ko: 나한테는 그런 말 한 적 없잖아

translation.en: [Jack] Have you thought about it?
[Pat] Just the other day, they said it's legal now to get married in Illinois.
translation.ko: 며칠 전에 들었는데 일리노이에선 동성 결혼이 이제 합법이라며

translation.en: -[Jack] Yeah. -[John] Mm-hmm.
And I said to Terry, "Well, what do you think, my dear?"
She says, "Well, I don't know."
Are you still holding out?
Jack, I'm not sure yet.
translation.ko: 잭, 난 아직 확신이 안 서

translation.en: We didn't know you were thinking about it. I think it's wonderful.
translation.ko: 결혼 고려 중인 줄 몰랐는데 좋은 생각 같아

translation.en: Well, I think it's delightful.
For me, there's no reason for it.
No? Okay.
Everything is going as it should right now.
Well, I feel the same way, John.
To me, I don't love another person as much as I love him.
translation.ko: 나야 존보다 더 사랑하는 사람이 있는 것도 아니잖아

translation.en: There you go.
I feel like John.
-I-- We've got everything settled and... -Uh-huh.
-...there's no reason for it, really. -But... But...
...why not?
[Pat] We lived in Chicago,
um, maybe 42 or 43 years, I believe.
Michigan Avenue is so pretty right now.
They have boulevards, and in the spring--
I'd like to get on one of those things.
[Pat] Segways, yeah.
[Terry] We worked 26 years in the same office.
People have said, how can you live together and work together for 26 years?
translation.ko: "존 행콕 센터 노스 미시간 애비뉴 875" 26년을 한 회사에서 일하고 한집에 살았다면 다들 놀라요

translation.en: [Pat] We had a wonderful time working together. We did.
We worked for Watson & Boaler, very fine interior design company.
[Terry] And we had a rich clientele.
[Pat] When we went to the office, we were strictly business.
We always wore dresses and high heels, and the makeup and lipstick,
translation.ko: 늘 원피스에 하이힐을 신었어요 립스틱 바르고 화장도 하고요

translation.en: the whole thing, always.
[Terry] We looked like ladies, and I think the people we met liked that.
translation.ko: 숙녀처럼 보였는데 만나는 사람들이 그걸 좋아했어요

translation.en: [Pat] Anybody who was not gay didn't know. They simply didn't.
translation.ko: 동성애자가 아닌 사람들은 몰랐어요, 알 턱이 없죠

translation.en: They just thought we were good friends, which of course, we were.
translation.ko: 우리를 그저 좋은 친구로만 알았어요, 물론 그것도 맞고요

translation.en: Very good friends.
[woman] Hello.
These ladies were part of the first tenants of the building.
translation.ko: 두 분은 이 건물에 최초로 입주했던 분들이세요

translation.en: On a windy day like today, you can hear the building...
translation.ko: 오늘처럼 바람이 심한 날은 건물에서 삐걱대는 소리가 났어요

translation.en: -...creak. I'm sure it still happens. -Here?
-Yeah. -Oh, God, no. We can't hear it creak.
Do you remember there was a hole in the ground?
-[Terry] Oh, yes. -[Pat] I remember it was so deep.
[Terry] We lived right over there. Right in the--
[Pat] You see that church there? We were very close to that.
translation.ko: 저기 교회 보여요? 거기서 아주 가까웠죠

translation.en: About four blocks, five blocks away from there.
translation.ko: 너덧 블록 정도 떨어져 있었을 거예요

translation.en: -[man] Old town? -[Pat] Yes.
[man] Oh, wow, yeah.
[Pat] It's been a while since we've seen our place.
We were on the second floor, and when we found this place,
translation.ko: 이 건물 2층에 살았어요 이 집을 찾았을 때...

translation.en: our landlord said, "I'm never going to let you go."
translation.ko: 집주인이 이랬어요 '이 집에서 못 나갈 줄 알아요'

translation.en: And he didn't. We were here for 20 years.
We just loved living here. It was great.
translation.ko: 이 집에 사는 게 만족스러웠어요 아주 좋았죠

translation.en: [Terry] Well, the area is so wonderful.
We just walked up here and got the bus.
[Pat] Get to work in what? Ten, 15 minutes from here, I think?
[man] Oh, my gosh.
You're a catcher.
-[Terry] I played utility. -[man] Awesome.
So you did actually have to wear dresses?
-Yes, we did. -Oh, my gosh.
-Did you ever slide into bases? -Oh, yeah, we all slid.
We had one girl that did 201 stolen bases in one year.
translation.ko: 1년 동안 도루를 201번이나 한 여자 선수도 있었어요

translation.en: No man has done that.
Oh, my gosh.
This little card, you know, it's so funny.
translation.ko: 이 조그만 카드가 참 재미난 물건이에요

translation.en: Um, when people know that you played in the All-American
translation.ko: 내가 왕년에 영화 '그들만의 리그'로 만들어진 올 아메리칸 리그에서 뛴 걸 알면

translation.en: and A League of Their Own, the movie, they get so excited.
translation.ko: 영화 '그들만의 리그'로 만들어진 올 아메리칸 리그에서 뛴 걸 알면 다들 흥분한다니까요

translation.en: And then if you give them a card, it just blows them away.
translation.ko: 거기다 이 카드를 주면 엄청나게 감동하죠

translation.en: It's so funny that little card has made so many people happy.
translation.ko: 이 작은 카드가 그 많은 사람을 행복하게 만든단 게 신기해요

translation.en: And all the girls say the same thing.
So I try to keep a couple in my purse.
translation.ko: 그래서 지갑에 몇 개씩 넣고 다니려고 해요

translation.en: [male announcer] That All-American pastime, baseball, brings out the All-American Girl Baseball League
translation.ko: 미국의 국민 스포츠 야구가 낳은 올 아메리칸 여자 야구 리그입니다

translation.en: for spring training at Alexandria, Virginia.
translation.ko: 버지니아주 알렉산드리아에서 선수들이 춘계 훈련 중입니다

translation.en: Okay, gals. Play ball.
[Terry] My dream certainly came true 'cause I can remember telling my dad,
translation.ko: 꿈이 이뤄진 거예요 아빠한테도 이렇게 말했었죠

translation.en: "If I could play ball every day, that would be my dream."
So it happened.
[Mary] And one of the women who actually got paid to play ball was Terry Donahue.
translation.ko: 테리 도너휴는 프로 선수로 야구를 했던 여성 중 하나입니다

translation.en: Terry played for the Peoria Redwings during World War II
translation.ko: 테리는 2차 대전 중 피오리아 레드윙스에서 뛰었죠

translation.en: on what they used to call the All-American Girls Baseball League.
translation.ko: 팀은 올 아메리칸 여자 야구 리그 소속이었습니다

translation.en: [Terry] Philip Wrigley, who had the Cubs,
he had the idea to fill the ballparks with women ballplayers.
translation.ko: 야구장을 여자 선수로 채워보겠다는 아이디어를 냈죠

translation.en: So he sent his scouts out through the United States and Canada
for the best softball players that they could find.
[Terry] He got 200 of them into Wrigley Field.
[Terry] And out of the 200, he chose 60 girls to form four teams.
And then he chose the Midwestern cities like Rockford,
translation.ko: 그다음 중서부 도시 몇 개를 골랐죠 선정된 도시는 록퍼드

translation.en: Kenosha, Racine,
South Bend,
Peoria
to be in the league he formed.
And I can say being Canadian...
translation.ko: 전 캐나다 사람으로서 "테리 도너휴 캐나다 무스조 출신, 포수"

translation.en: that we were very happy that Wrigley included Canada.
translation.ko: 리글리가 캐나다도 포함한 게 정말 기뻤어요

translation.en: There were also a couple of girls from Cuba.
translation.ko: 쿠바에서 온 선수도 몇 명 있었죠

translation.en: Here's the old tractor.
Oh, my. There's the old farmhouse.
Oh, here's Dad holding me.
I tell you, it was a happy home.
I was born and raised on a farm in Melaval, Saskatchewan.
Of course, I grew up during the Depression,
and there was no money and after you had your homework done,
translation.ko: 돈이 없다 보니 숙제를 하고 나면

translation.en: what was there to do?
So I just went out and played with my brother.
translation.ko: 그래서 밖에 나가 오빠랑 공놀이를 했어요

translation.en: He was an excellent ballplayer,
and I think because of him, made me better because he would throw me grounders,
translation.ko: 오빠 덕에 실력이 향상됐어요 나한테 땅볼을 던지곤 했는데

translation.en: and, you know, how brothers they want you to miss it,
translation.ko: 남자 형제들이 다 그렇듯이 잡지 못하게 던졌죠

translation.en: and he would throw 'em harder and hit 'em hard to me.
translation.ko: 일부러 세게 던져서 공으로 날 맞혔어요

translation.en: So I think that was kind of fortunate for me.
-[Mary] So when the scout came... -[bicycle bell rings]
...how old were you, and what grade were you in?
translation.ko: 스카우터가 왔을 때 몇 살이었죠? 몇 학년이었어요?

translation.en: [Terry] When I was playing ball in school,
I was scouted from the team in Moose Jaw
to go in there to play during the holidays after school was out.
translation.ko: 학기가 끝나고 방학 동안 그 팀에서 경기했죠

translation.en: When the scout from the States came, I was 19.
And I came down here when I was 20.
I came down in 1946, all by myself.
I didn't know about Chicago, how big it was or anything.
translation.ko: 시카고가 얼마나 큰 곳인지 어떤 곳인지 아무것도 몰랐어요

translation.en: All I know is that I was coming down for a tryout, and I could hardly wait.
translation.ko: 트라이아웃이 있단 것만 알았고 조바심이 났었어요

translation.en: So my number came out.
I ran out to shortstop, and then they started hitting balls.
translation.ko: 내 차례가 됐고 유격수로 테스트받았어요 사람들이 공을 치기 시작했죠

translation.en: I tell ya, I had a good day that day 'cause I was picking them up like crazy
translation.ko: 그날 제법 잘했어요 정신없이 공을 잡았죠

translation.en: -and running for them and getting them. -[crowd cheering]
And then I had a dirty bounce that cut my eyebrow.
translation.ko: 그러다 불규칙 바운드 된 공을 맞고 눈썹 부분이 째졌어요

translation.en: So I went off to the side, and they said, "Take her for stitches."
translation.ko: 그라운드 밖으로 나갔더니 가서 상처를 꿰매라더군요

translation.en: I said, "No. Put a Band-Aid on it. I'm going back out. I'm not finished."
translation.ko: 난 아직 안 끝났으니 반창고만 붙이고 더 뛰겠다고 했죠

translation.en: They brought me back and said, "Gutsy kid."
translation.ko: 날 다시 데려다주고는 '배짱 좋은 애'라고 하더군요

translation.en: And then came allocation day,
translation.ko: 얼마 후 팀을 배정하는 날이 됐어요

translation.en: and I'll never forget it.
It was in this great big room with all the young girls
translation.ko: 커다란 방에 젊은 여자들이 꽉 차 있었죠

translation.en: who were all there trying to make it.
My name wasn't being called,
it wasn't being called,
wasn't being called, and I thought to myself,
translation.ko: 계속 호명이 안 되기에 속으로 생각했죠

translation.en: "Well, I guess I'll have to go back home and say I wasn't good enough."
translation.ko: '이제 고향에 돌아가서 내 실력이 부족했다고 해야겠구나'

translation.en: And then my name was called for Peoria Redwings.
translation.ko: 바로 그다음 내 이름이 불렸어요 피오리아 레드윙스에 배정됐죠

translation.en: I tell you, Chris, I was the happiest girl in that room.
translation.ko: 크리스, 그 순간은 내가 그 방에서 제일 행복한 여자였어요

translation.en: I stayed with them all four years, and they never traded me.
translation.ko: 4년 내내 같은 팀에 있었어요 팀에서 날 트레이드 안 했거든요

translation.en: [Yvonne] These women had clearly laid down a foundation
translation.ko: 말할 것도 없이 그 선수들이 초석이 되어준 겁니다

translation.en: for women athletes of all kinds who were following them.
translation.ko: 종목을 불문하고 뒤이어 나온 여성 운동 선수들에게요

translation.en: -[classical string music playing] -[woman] Heads up.
Back straight.
And sit.
[Terry] Even though they had to jump through all kinds of hoops
translation.ko: 비록 여러 가지 까다로운 절차를 거쳐야만

translation.en: in order to get to play...
[Terry] ...they all had to go to charm school...
[woman] Don't slurp!
[Terry] ...and learn how to put on makeup.
They wanted us to look like ladies and play ball like men,
translation.ko: 숙녀의 외모를 하고 사내처럼 플레이하길 바랐죠

translation.en: and that's what we did.
translation.ko: 실제로 그렇게 했고요 - 슬라이딩은 글렀네 - 난 좋은데

translation.en: This is our uniform.
It had to be six inches above the knee, and they were skirts.
translation.ko: 무릎 위 15cm 길이의 스커트를 입어야 했죠

translation.en: [male announcer] "Tiby" Eisen slides home with a run and a nicely bruised leg.
translation.ko: 티미 아이젠, 홈으로 쇄도하며 득점하고 다리엔 멍이 듭니다

translation.en: Better a bruise than long pants, hey, gals?
translation.ko: 그래도 멍드는 게 긴 바지보다 낫죠? 아가씨들?

translation.en: People thought, "Well, they're gonna go out and have a good laugh.
translation.ko: 사람들은 여자 야구를 보면서 한바탕 웃을 생각이었죠

translation.en: Women playing in skirts playing baseball."
translation.ko: '치마 입고 야구 하는 여자들이라니 말이 돼?'

translation.en: But when they came out and saw how well we played,
translation.ko: 하지만 야구장에 와서 우리가 경기하는 걸 보고는

translation.en: they came back every night.
[Terry] And in 1948, our league drew a million people.
translation.ko: 1948년엔 관중 백만 명이 우리 리그를 보러 왔죠

translation.en: -[ball clacks] -[triumphant organ music plays]
[Yvonne] I think they were feminists.
They were playing baseball, for goodness sake.
translation.ko: 그 시절 야구를 한다는 건 말도 안 되는 일이었어요

translation.en: Women didn't do that.
They had the courage to do something so different
translation.ko: 남들과는 완전히 다른 일을 할 용기를 가졌던 사람들이에요

translation.en: in a time when "different" was not looked on as something good.
translation.ko: 남다른 게 긍정적으로 평가받지 못하던 시기에 말입니다

translation.en: We had a great group of gals.
My good friend, Betty,
we played on the same team.
She said, "Terry, I don't know if you know anything about this.
When these women get together, they like another woman."
translation.ko: '여자 선수들끼리 모여서 다른 여자한테 작업 걸기도 한대'

translation.en: And I said, "No, I haven't."
translation.ko: 난 그런 얘긴 못 들어봤다고 했죠

translation.en: And she said, "I just wanted to let you know what goes on
translation.ko: 베티가 주변에서 무슨 일이 일어나는지 말해주고 싶었다며

translation.en: so you're aware of it."
I'd never heard of those kind of girls.
[Terry] I mean, I didn't know which ones were which,
but Betty and I weren't taking any chances.
translation.ko: 베티랑 나는 공연한 위험은 피하자 싶었죠

translation.en: We'd lock our door.
We'd move our dresser. We'd move our chairs. We'd put it at the door.
translation.ko: 서랍장을 옮기고, 의자도 옮겨서 문 앞을 막아놨죠

translation.en: Because we didn't want 'em in our room.
I didn't know what to think until I met Pat.
I don't know what happened, but that was it.
translation.ko: 어떻게 된 일인진 모르겠지만 그렇게 됐답니다

translation.en: [Pat] It was one of the best days of my life
translation.ko: 그 시절이 제 인생에서 제일 좋았던 때예요

translation.en: when I met her on that Sunday morning in the hockey rink in Moose Jaw.
translation.ko: 어느 일요일 아침 무스조의 하키 링크에서 테리를 만났죠

translation.en: I think I was 18.
She was, like, 22, maybe, yeah.
So it all started back in 1947.
It seems like another lifetime really.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 인생을 두 번은 더 산 거 같아요

translation.en: And we laugh because we think, "How can that be?" You know?
translation.ko: 테리랑 얘기하며 가끔 웃죠 이게 어떻게 가능할까 하면서요

translation.en: So many years, and yet...
it seems like it just started yesterday.
[Terry] We went skating this one night together.
translation.ko: 어느 날 밤 같이 스케이트를 타러 갔어요

translation.en: And at the next corner, she'd go that way, and I go this way.
translation.ko: 다음 모퉁이에서 팻은 저쪽으로, 난 이쪽으로 갔죠

translation.en: She said, "Here." She hands me this piece of paper.
I could hardly wait to get to the next light.
translation.ko: 불빛이 있는 곳까지 가는데 어찌나 안달이 나던지요

translation.en: It was the most beautiful note that Pat wrote.
translation.ko: 정말로 아름다운 글이었어요 팻이 쓴 거였죠

translation.en: And she says, "I'm a reader."
And I read lots of stories,
but I've never known where another woman had loved another woman.
translation.ko: 하지만 여자가 여자를 사랑하는 얘기는 어디서도 못 봤어요

translation.en: And she says, "Above all things,
I hope it's mutual."
But I wanted to turn around and run back.
[Pat] We almost got locked in the Catholic church once.
translation.ko: 성당에 꼼짝없이 갇힐 뻔한 적이 있어요

translation.en: [Terry] Because there was a sandstorm.
[Pat] We were walking right down Main Street, and we kissed.
translation.ko: 메인 스트리트를 따라 걷다가 둘이 입을 맞췄어요

translation.en: Nobody could see us, because there was a sandstorm.
translation.ko: 모래 폭풍 때문에 아무도 우리를 못 봤죠

translation.en: [Terry] It was really hard to get together.
[Pat] It was.
[Terry] One time we checked into the hotel with no suitcase or nothing.
translation.ko: 한번은 여행 가방 하나 없이 호텔에 투숙한 적도 있어요

translation.en: [Pat] I can't believe we did that.
[Terry] And I was very well-known there because of sports.
translation.ko: 운동 때문에 그 동네에서 제법 얼굴이 알려져 있었는데도요

translation.en: -[Pat] And we played hockey. -[Terry] And we played hockey.
[Pat] And our pictures would be in the paper. I thought, "Oh, my God.
translation.ko: 우리 얼굴이 신문에 실리곤 했다니까요, 간도 컸지...

translation.en: This is not the best thing to do."
[Terry] But when I got her out to the farm, that was happy times.
translation.ko: 팻을 우리 농장에 불렀을 때가 참 좋았어요

translation.en: When a holiday would come along,
I'd be so excited about going home, and I said to Pat,
translation.ko: 집에 가는 게 너무 기대됐죠 팻한테 말했어요

translation.en: I said, "Well, you come home with me,
And I'll guarantee you you'll have a good time."
So, when she said, "No, I can't do that." I said, "You do that.
translation.ko: 팻은 안 된다고 빼고 난 오라고 졸랐어요

translation.en: You be on that train, and I'll be at the station."
And then Pat came off the train.
And we had a good time.
And in the meantime, I was going with Bill from Peoria,
translation.ko: 당시에 난 피오리아에 사는 빌이란 남자를 만나고 있었어요

translation.en: and he'd drive all the way up to Canada.
translation.ko: 빌이 차를 몰고 캐나다까지 다녀가곤 했죠

translation.en: And I said, "You can come, but don't bring the rain."
translation.ko: 난 빌한테 오는 건 괜찮은데 큰 기대는 말라고 했어요

translation.en: He would come in the front door, and I'd go out the back with Terry.
translation.ko: 빌이 앞문으로 들어오는데 우리는 뒷문으로 나간 적도 있어요

translation.en: [Pat] I was almost married when I was 18, and the young man I was engaged to...
translation.ko: 18살 때 결혼할 뻔했어요 그런데 결혼을 약속했던 남자가...

translation.en: um... died.
Then I was going with another young man.
translation.ko: 그 뒤에 또 다른 남자를 만났어요

translation.en: This is during the war.
Going with another young man who was a pilot, and he was killed.
And then I was going with the son of a farmer.
He was on a tractor that rolled over,
translation.ko: 그 사람은 타고 있던 트랙터가 전복되는 바람에

translation.en: and he died.
All of these strange things are happening, and I thought,
translation.ko: 자꾸 이상한 일들이 일어나니까 이런 생각이 들더군요

translation.en: "This is not what I was supposed to do."
That was before I met Terry.
That changed everything.
[Terry] Yeah.
Patty, you were meant for me.
[Pat] I think you're right.
[Terry] But Pat and I both had men interested.
translation.ko: 하지만 팻이랑 나랑 각자 남자에 관심 있을 때도 있었어요

translation.en: [Pat] Oh, my God. I was with this guy, this Len guy.
Len and I drove down in 1949.
We traveled with her team for two weeks.
So we watched them play, and it was wonderful.
-I roomed with Terry... -[Terry] See?
[Pat] ...and he had to stay at a hotel.
[Pat] And I was a long-distance operator. I could always find you.
translation.ko: 난 장거리 전화 교환원이라 언제든 자기한테 연락할 수 있었지

translation.en: This is wild. It was after the season, and you'd bought that old car...
translation.ko: 이때도 난리였지, 시즌 끝난 후에 자기가 중고차를 샀었잖아

translation.en: -[Terry] Yeah. -[Pat] ...with those other gals.
And they were driving from Chicago back to Moose Jaw.
translation.ko: 다 같이 시카고에서부터 무스조까지 운전해 왔어요

translation.en: [Terry] And that's 1,500 miles--
[Pat] I found her along the way. And I found a motel, and she was there.
translation.ko: 도중에 테리를 찾아냈어요 모텔에 전화했더니 거기 있더군요

translation.en: I couldn't get away with a thing.
But I was shocked when the phone rang and it was Pat.
translation.ko: 전화 받고 얼마나 놀랐다고요 팻의 전화였어요

translation.en: [Pat] "Hi, Terry."
She nearly flipped.
Len, his mother, and his dad wanted me to marry him.
translation.ko: 글렌이랑 그 사람 부모님은 우리가 결혼하길 바랐어요

translation.en: His sister was coming after me.
translation.ko: 그 사람 누이도 날 만나러 왔고

translation.en: His brother was coming after me, and I said, "Terry, we got to leave.
translation.ko: 형제도 날 찾아왔었죠 그래서 테리한테 떠나자고 했어요

translation.en: We have to get out of here."
[Terry] Pat said we were the only two people in the world like this.
translation.ko: 팻은 세상에 우리 같은 사람들은 또 없을 거라고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "Well, let's go to the States."
[Pat] We thought it would be easier to be ourselves.
[Terry] But we didn't know anybody. We were just happy to be together.
translation.ko: 아는 사람도 없고 둘이 같이 있어 마냥 행복했어요

translation.en: I was playing ball. Pat got a job.
translation.ko: 난 야구를 하고 팻은 일자리를 구했죠

translation.en: And then I went home after ball season to see my dad.
translation.ko: 야구 시즌이 끝나고 아빠를 만나러 고향에 갔어요

translation.en: And I told Pat I would be back.
I came back and got a job.
We got this furnished apartment.
It had two rooms.
Had a great big brown old chair that fit the two of us.
translation.ko: 그 집엔 둘이 같이 앉을 수 있는 낡고 커다란 밤색 의자도 있었죠

translation.en: It was hard to meet nice people,
which we did after a while.
We were very careful.
[Pat] Really? You're not sure yet.
What year? What year will you be sure?
I have worried about saying something to Al.
I had five brothers, and I've lost all but one.
translation.ko: 남자 형제가 다섯 있었는데 하나 빼고는 다 일찍 죽었죠

translation.en: And he's three years younger than me, and we're very close.
translation.ko: 앨은 나보다 세 살 어리고 나랑 아주 친해요

translation.en: I dearly love him.
And he loves Terry.
We were on the phone, so I just blurted it out.
translation.ko: 어느 날 앨과 통화하다가 무심결에 털어놓고 말았어요

translation.en: I said, "You know, Terry and I have been...
together for a long time, many, many years, I think."
And I said, uh,
"You know, we're thinking about getting married."
Big silence.
And he said, "You can't do it. It'd hurt our family."
translation.ko: 앨이 안 된다는 거예요 식구들한테 상처가 된다나요?

translation.en: I said, "How could it possibly hurt our family?"
translation.ko: 어째서 그게 식구들한테 상처가 되냐고 물었어요

translation.en: He said, "I don't want you to tell anybody in my family."
I thought he'd act this way.
translation.ko: 난 앨이 그렇게 나올 줄 알았어

translation.en: I like Al. He's a wonderful guy, but he's very close-minded.
translation.ko: 앨을 좋아하고, 훌륭한 사람이지만 생각이 꽉 막혀있잖아

translation.en: I said, "I hope you have a change in your heart."
translation.ko: 난 앨한테 마음이 바뀌길 바란다고 말했어요

translation.en: What else could I say?
So, I mean, if we decide we're going to get married, we will...
translation.ko: 어쨌거나 우리가 결혼하기로 작정하면 하는 거죠

translation.en: regardless.
Yeah. He won't sway us either way.
translation.ko: 맞아, 앨이 우리를 좌지우지할 수는 없지

translation.en: [Pat] No.
Um, and. uh--
And if he can't accept it, that's his problem.
translation.ko: 앨이 못 받아들인대도 그건 걔 문제야

translation.en: [Pat] I can't see him walking away from his only sister.
translation.ko: 동생이 유일한 누나와 인연을 끊는 건 못 봐요

translation.en: I can't see that happening.
I was born in Cabri, Saskatchewan,
on September 27, 1928.
And I had five brothers and a sister.
There were seven of us.
We had a really nice farm. We had cliffs.
translation.ko: 우리 가족에겐 근사한 농장이 있었어요 절벽도 있었는데 거기에 올라가 시를 쓰곤 했어요

translation.en: I used to go up there and write poetry.
translation.ko: 절벽도 있었는데 거기에 올라가 시를 쓰곤 했어요

translation.en: And we had creeks, and we had a dam, and some horses.
translation.ko: 개울하고 댐이 있고 말도 몇 마리 있었죠

translation.en: My dad had a small dairy.
And he delivered milk to the people in town.
I had two brothers who were in the Air Force during the war.
Uh, and my brother, Wally...
he was my mother's favorite child.
He was her favorite.
Anyway, he wanted to be a pilot. He was only 17.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 월리가 조종사가 되겠다고 나섰어요, 겨우 17살 때요

translation.en: And she signed for him to join up.
And he got to England on his 19th birthday.
Oh, my.
[voice breaking] Anyway, he completed all his flights, the whole tour.
translation.ko: 월리는 비행 임무를 완수하고 군 복무를 마치게 됐죠

translation.en: Then they borrowed him for one more flight, and he was killed.
translation.ko: 근데 비행을 한 번만 더 하라며 차출됐다가 전사했어요

translation.en: He was shot down over Germany.
Mother died two years later...
I think of heartbreak.
I was only 15 when she died.
After my mother died, my dad remarried.
And so I had a stepmother,
and a stepsister, and two stepbrothers.
translation.ko: 의붓자매 하나 의붓형제 둘을 갖게 됐어요

translation.en: We didn't think that she was the greatest mother in the world.
translation.ko: 의붓어머니는 우리한테 딱히 좋은 엄마는 아니었죠

translation.en: They would go away for the weekend,
and they'd lock all the good food in the basement.
translation.ko: 좋은 음식은 다 지하실에 넣고 잠가 버렸어요

translation.en: What kind of a household is this?
[Pat] 1959, my father and my stepmother were killed
at a railroad crossing.
[Pat] The train hit them, and they were both killed.
translation.ko: 기차가 두 분을 치면서 변을 당했죠

translation.en: Terry's mom and dad came to the funeral.
They were wonderful to me.
After my mother died, why,
I met Terry's mom and dad.
The very first thing Terry's father said to me is, "I'm going to adopt you."
translation.ko: 테리의 아버지가 처음 한 말씀이 '내가 널 입양하마'였죠 "팻 + 아빠"

translation.en: Terry and her family, they loved me, and they... and they showed it.
translation.ko: 테리와 가족들은 날 사랑하고 그걸 표현해 줬어요

translation.en: And this is what everybody needs.
You felt that you were loved and cared about.
Hey, that's good!

but everything that came to me was just a love song.

[Pat laughing] Me heart, me heart.
This is a love song.
-Eh? -[Terry] Yeah.
[Pat] Eh. That's Canadian.

♪ You are my love ♪

I hope.
♪ You are my love ♪
♪ So many years together ♪
♪ Many more to come ♪
♪ You are my love ♪
[Pat] That's beautiful.
Tammy, I think after that song, we will get married.
translation.ko: 노래 듣고 생각했는데 우리 결혼할까 봐

translation.en: Okay?
Can I be a bridesmaid?
[Terry] You can be a bridesmaid.
-[Kim] Can I be the best man? -Yes, you can be the best man.
translation.ko: - 신랑 들러리는 접니다? - 그러려무나 신랑 들러리

translation.en: [Pat] Yes!
Oh, my God.
Can we do that?
Yeah, let's do it.
[Tammy] ♪ You are my love ♪
[man] How have you been doing with doing the exercises and all?
-[Terry] Good. -[man] Doing 'em?
[Terry] I've been doing them.
What are you having difficulty with at this point?
translation.ko: 요즘 편찮으신 데는 없고요? "제프 샌드버그 물리 치료사"

translation.en: It's the-- It's the hip.
-[Jeff] The hip? Okay. -Yeah.
Because you had both hips replaced.
-No-- Yeah. They were both replaced. -[Terry] Yeah.
[Jeff] It's important to stay active because of the Parkinson's
translation.ko: 계속 움직이는 게 중요해요 고관절뿐만 아니라 파킨슨병 때문에도

translation.en: as well as for those hips and just to stay active for--
translation.ko: 고관절뿐만 아니라 파킨슨병 때문에도 계속 몸을 쓰셔야...

translation.en: I like these exercises very much,
and I'll tell you why: they don't go on and on and on.
translation.ko: 왠지 알아? 마냥 계속하는 게 아니잖아

translation.en: [Jeff] I want to see how well you're getting out of that chair.
translation.ko: 그럼 의자에서 얼마나 잘 일어나시는지 볼까요?

translation.en: -One! -[Jeff and Pat] There you go.
-Two! -That a girl.
-Three! -[Jeff] Get those arms up a little higher.
-Four! -[Jeff] Good.
Five!
Good.
Six!
-Seven! -[Jeff] Beautiful.
Eight!
-Good. Go ahead and relax. -I go to ten.
-You wanna do ten? You can do ten. -[Pat laughing]
-Nine! -That's the athlete in you right there.
-Ten! -[Pat] There you go, Terry.
-There you go. -Nice job.
[Jeff] Bring this foot forwards.
So obviously, some postural changes are normal as we age,
translation.ko: 나이가 들면서 자세가 변하는 건 당연해요

translation.en: but a tendency with Parkinson's, remember,
is to lean forward and bend over a little bit.
Like an old lady.
Yeah, but you don't act like an old lady, Terry.
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 테리 동작은 호호 할머니 같진 않아요

translation.en: [Pat] Well, you know,
she has days when she's not too bad and then days where it's not so great.
translation.ko: 몸 상태가 괜찮은 날도 있고 안 좋은 날도 있어요

translation.en: But tomorrow, she's gonna have a second shot,
translation.ko: 내일 두 번째로 주사를 맞을 텐데요

translation.en: and we're just praying that this time it's going to help.
Because the first time it did her no good at all.
translation.ko: 처음 맞은 주사는 전혀 도움이 안 됐거든요

translation.en: The pain is terrible, and she's on pain pills.
translation.ko: 통증이 너무 심해서 진통제를 먹고 있어요

translation.en: You know, she's supposed to take one every four hours.
translation.ko: 원래 4시간마다 한 알씩 먹으라고 돼 있지만

translation.en: We're trying to spread that out a bit.
She doesn't take 'em that often.
But...
My one concern is her health.
I want her to be well. I want her to be happy.
There are so many things now that she's not able to do
translation.ko: 이제 테리가 못 하는 일들이 제법 많아졌어요

translation.en: because of that tremor in her hand.
So I watch over everything.
I don't want her to be alone.
It's-- It's a worry.
What she means to me.
[voice breaking] She means everything to me.
Get your cane, and then we'll go.
All righty.
Okay.
I gotta be careful.
Yes. Want me to help you?
[Diana] What's worrying me is, uh, is the deterioration that I'm seeing...
translation.ko: 상황이 점점 안 좋아지고 있어서 걱정이에요

translation.en: and the lack of progress that Pat's making in terms of trying to get a plan together
translation.ko: 이사 문제 관련해서 팻이 아무 진전을 안 보이는 것도 마음이 무겁고요

translation.en: to get them moving.
translation.ko: 팻이 아무 진전을 안 보이는 것도 마음이 무겁고요

translation.en: I mean, she's not... she's not... she's not doing anything.
She's not budging at all.
And I'm getting frustrated with that.
The problem is Auntie Terry wants to move, and Pat doesn't.
translation.ko: 테리 고모는 이사를 원하는데 팻은 아닌 게 문제예요

translation.en: I think I'm going to have to do an intervention.
I mean, that's the only choice I've got.
-There's nobody home. -[Diana laughs]
-Patty. -[Pat chuckles] Hi, baby.
-How are ya? -Mmm.
-[Pat] Oh, nice to see you at last. -Where's... [grunts]
-Oh, my goodness, how nice you look. -[Terry] Is that little Diana?
translation.ko: - 정말 보기 좋다 - 우리 다이애나 왔니?

translation.en: Look at you.
-My Diana. -[Terry] Is that little Diana?
translation.ko: - 우리 다이애나 - 우리 조카 온 거야?

translation.en: I'm scared to see her, Patty.
-Oh, I'm-- I'm doing pretty good-- -Hi!
[Terry] Diana.
That's her little darling.
Good to see you.
[Terry] My God, you must've been tired.
Oh, my God, it's good to see you.
[Terry] Oh, it's wonderful.
Now let me look at you.
-[Pat] She looks wonderful. -You look great.
translation.ko: - 아주 보기 좋아 - 정말 좋아 보인다

translation.en: The last time I saw you guys, Auntie Terry was probably ten or 15,
translation.ko: 저번에 만났을 때보다 테리 고모가 5~7kg은 빠진 거 같아요

translation.en: -maybe even 20 pounds heavier... -[Terry] Yeah.
-...than you are now. -[Pat] Exactly.
She should weigh about 125.
[Diana] Are you eating?
Yeah, I'm eating.
[Pat] I don't know if she's eating enough, though.
translation.ko: - 너무 적게 먹는 거 아닌지 몰라 - 그러게요

translation.en: [Diana] Yeah, probably not, eh. You got a good appetite?
translation.ko: - 너무 적게 먹는 거 아닌지 몰라 - 그러게요 전엔 잘 드셨잖아요

translation.en: Well, I been eating... as much as you, Pat.
translation.ko: 지금도 잘 먹어 팻이 먹는 만큼은 먹는다고

translation.en: [Pat] No.
[Diana] You've got the frozen dinners now coming in?
[Pat] Yeah. We have frozen dinners that we buy.
translation.ko: 응, 냉동된 거 사다가 먹고 있지

translation.en: This is the time in your life where you should be having people cook your meals.
translation.ko: 이제는 다른 사람들이 해주는 음식 드실 때예요

translation.en: You should be having people clean your house.
This is the time...
that you should be not worrying about anything,
and I think all we're all doing is worrying like crazy
over what's gonna happen.
[Terry] Well, I had a dream.
I dreamt that we sold the place with everything in it,
translation.ko: 살림 그대로 다 두고 집을 파는 게 소원이야

translation.en: and that's the way I think we should go.
[Pat] Oh, I can't do that.
Like these chairs, no way am I gonna leave these.
translation.ko: 이 의자만 해도 절대로 못 두고 가

translation.en: -Oh, Pat. You-- You-- -I am not going to leave these chairs.
translation.ko: 아이고, 팻... 우리 집 의자들은 절대로 못 버려

translation.en: Those two lamps are going to go with us, that's for sure.
translation.ko: 저기 있는 램프 두 개도 꼭 가져가야 하고

translation.en: Paintings. We're going to take the paintings, certainly.
[Terry] All this stuff... There's stuff all over the place.
translation.ko: 이 집엔 뭐가 너무 많아 온 집안이 물건 천지라니까

translation.en: [Diana] You can keep your stuff. Nobody's gonna tell you.
translation.ko: 얼마든지 가져가세요 아무도 뭐라고 안 해요

translation.en: You don't have to give your stuff away, but we got to get you out of here.
translation.ko: 물건은 처분 안 해도 되지만 이 집에선 이사하셔야 해요

translation.en: I mean, I guess we have to figure out what place you want to live in.
translation.ko: 어디 살지부터 같이 고민해 보는 게 좋겠어요

translation.en: Like, do you want to live here or Florida? I know you don't want to come to Canada.
translation.ko: 여기가 좋아요? 아니면 플로리다? 캐나다는 싫으신 거죠?

translation.en: No. You know, Edmonton really doesn't turn me on.
And I don't know why, but it doesn't.
[Diana] Well...
[Pat] I loved Sarasota.
[Terry] Yeah, I like Florida, too.
It's very beautiful, and I have a good time when I'm down there.
translation.ko: 아름다운 곳인 데다 거기 가면 늘 좋더라고

translation.en: But it's no place for us now.
[Pat] Nice and warm. Nice and green.
[Terry] And I can't drive.
You don't know how long you can drive, and then you're stuck out there.
translation.ko: 자기도 언제까지 할 수 있을지 모르는데, 꼼짝도 못 하게 되면?

translation.en: You're looking at a golf course
and little stream of water.
-[Diana chuckles] -Got a little stream of water.
I-- That's not the place.
Not the place.
It wouldn't be so bad even if you found a nice place and stay here.
translation.ko: 근처에서 괜찮은 데를 찾아서 여기 있는 것도 나쁘지 않지

translation.en: -[Diana] In St. Charles? -Yeah.
[Diana] They must have nice places here that you can go into.
translation.ko: 여기에도 분명 두 분이 갈 만한 곳이 있을 거예요

translation.en: They're very expensive.
[Diana] Yeah, but it's gonna get very expensive anyway if one of you gets sick
translation.ko: 그렇긴 한데, 내가... 둘 중 한 분이 아파서 다른 분이 종일 간병인을 쓰면

translation.en: and the other one has to have a full-time person in here.
translation.ko: 그때는 말도 못 하게 큰돈이 들 텐데요?

translation.en: Then maybe we should start looking at places here.
Do you think?
Yeah.
[Diana] Patty?
I suppose we could. Mm-hmm.
[Diana] So when you're standing up like this, is it hurting you?
No, it doesn't hurt right now.
I'm playing bridge today at the CU.
Auntie Terry, we got to sort this out.
Yeah, we got to go to Edmonton.
We can go away in the winter.
I don't think you're going to get agreement on that, darling.
translation.ko: 팻이 순순히 그러자고 할 거 같지가 않네요

translation.en: [Diana] Pull up that place that you just mentioned.
Dell-- Dell something.
I think it's Delnor Glen.
[Diana] I can look it up on here so you can keep doing what you're doing.
translation.ko: 전 이거로 찾아볼게요 하던 거 마저 하세요

translation.en: [Pat] No. I just want to get rid of this.
That's your pill, Terry.
You make sure you eat this whole thing.
-Okay. -You have to.
-Pat? -[Pat] Hmm?
[Diana] If we went to that place today...
[Pat] Yeah.
[Diana] ...and they said to us...
that there's a spot open next month
that you could have,
we could do it.
[Pat laughs] No.
Yeah, we could.
We could. Once you put your mind to it, you get it done.
[Pat] Okay.
[Terry] I won't sleep long.
Hi, Debbie. My name is Diana Bolan, and I'm here visiting from Canada.
translation.ko: 데비, 전 캐나다에서 방문 중인 다이애나 볼란이라고 해요

translation.en: I'm visiting with my aunts.
And I am interested in... in what your facility has to offer,
and I was wondering if it would be possible for me
to come over there this afternoon or tomorrow
translation.ko: 오늘 오후나 내일 가 봤으면 하는데요

translation.en: and take a look at it while I'm in St. Charles?
All right, you close your eyes.
-Okay? -Okay.
All righty.
Okay.
[Diana] Okay. Appreciate it a lot. Thanks a lot, Debbie.
-[Debbie] Thank you. -Bye.
Did you find Delnor?
[Diana] I talked to Delnor Glen.
And...
a one bedroom is $5,000 a month.
Five thousand dollars a month?
And the extra person is 1,500.
So it's $6,845 a month.
-A month? -For one person.
-[Diana] For two. -For two.
How much?
Almost $7,000.
That's 84 a year.
-[Pat] Eighty-four thou? -[Diana] Yeah.
[Pat] That's a little bit pricey for me.
I don't know. Better to croak, I think.
So I wonder if there's any other places we could phone.
translation.ko: 혹시 더 알아볼 곳 없는지 볼게요

translation.en: Retirement communities.
[Terry] See, I thought I had some stuff.
[Diana] That's not a retire--
Oh, Marlene said she gave you a bunch of stuff.
translation.ko: 참, 말린이 그러는데 뭘 잔뜩 드렸다면서요?

translation.en: That's right.
[Pat] We tossed it out.
-[Diana] You threw it out? -[Pat] Yeah.
[Terry] No. We did not throw it out.
[Pat] I thought we did.
[Terry] When was that?
[Diana] Here, honey. I got it.
[Terry] I'm gonna look in here.
Now just wait a minute.
[Pat] What are you doing, Terry? There's a lot of stuff in there.
translation.ko: 테리, 거기서 뭐 해? 거기는 짐이 산더미야 들어가지 마

translation.en: You better not go in there.
What are you trying to do, Terry?
[Terry] I want to take another look.
[Pat sighs] Terry, they're not there.

We went all the way through there. There's nothing there.
translation.ko: 거기는 전에도 다 봤었어 아무것도 없어

[Pat] No, don't.
-[Terry] Going to. -I don't want you to.
translation.ko: - 보여줄 거야 - 난 안 그러면 좋겠어

translation.en: No. No. Absolutely not.
[Diana] You've known me all my life. I don't know why you don't trust me.
translation.ko: 평생 봐 오셨으면서 아직도 그렇게 절 못 믿겠어요?

translation.en: -[Pat] I do! -I have no motivation, nothing!
translation.ko: - 믿어! - 다른 뜻이 있는 게 아니라고요!

translation.en: -Except to take care of her. -[Pat] Don't get so excited.
translation.ko: - 고모를 챙기고 싶을 뿐이에요 - 흥분하지 마

translation.en: How can I not be excited when you're sitting on all this money,
translation.ko: 그 돈 다 깔고 앉아서 저한테는 계속 돈 없다고 하는데

translation.en: and you keep telling me you can't afford it?
It doesn't make any sense to me.
Auntie Terry is at risk now.
-[Pat] I know. -And so are you.
And I don't know why you don't want me to do anything or know anything,
translation.ko: 근데 왜 전 아무것도 못 하게 하고 아무것도 안 가르쳐주세요?

translation.en: -but I'm gonna tell you, Pat... -[Pat] Oh, hell.
...what I am is straight-up,
and I will never, ever, ever, ever, ever let Auntie Terry be at risk.
translation.ko: 절대로, 무슨 일이 있어도 고모를 내버려 두진 않을 거예요

translation.en: [Diana] I've been wanting to come down for a year, and you kept telling me,
translation.ko: 1년 내내 내려오겠다고 했는데 아줌마는 계속 이랬죠

translation.en: "No, don't come, don't come, don't come." I come here.
She's 100 pounds!
Your back is sore,

translation.ko: 아줌마는 내가 테리 고모를 얼마나 사랑하는지 몰라요

translation.en: [sniffles] You just don't!
All I want is Auntie Terry safe.
That's all!
-[Pat] God almighty, Diana. -[Diana] That's all!
translation.ko: - 다이애나, 거기는 너무 비싸 - 다른 뜻은 없어요

translation.en: [Diana sobbing] I'm so tired of fighting with this!
I-- I cannot believe...
that you feel that I-- I'm...
trying to keep anything from you because I'm not. I'm not.
translation.ko: 뭘 숨긴다고 생각했다니 말이야 그렇지 않아

translation.en: I am not!
When you said that last night, it was like bang, right in the heart!
translation.ko: 어젯밤에 그 말 하셨을 때 가슴에 대못이 박히는 거 같았어요

translation.en: [Pat] Just... What did I say?
You said to Terry, "Don't tell her anything."
[Pat] What?
"Don't... tell her anything. Don't tell her anything, Terry.
translation.ko: '안 돼' '그 애한테 아무 말 하지 마 아무 말 하지 마, 테리'

translation.en: Please don't tell her anything."
translation.ko: '제발 그 애한테 아무 말 하지 마'

translation.en: That's really not true because Pat is...
-[Pat] No, no, no, no, no, no.. -It's a game.
[Pat] Well, I think you kind of know, anyway, don't you, Diane?
translation.ko: 어차피 너도 알 건 다 알잖니 안 그래?

translation.en: -Did it-- -I told Aunt Terry this morning
I didn't want to see her stuff.
She brought it out anyway.
I looked at it. She wanted me to see it.
I looked at it. She said-- I said, "I don't want to see it."
She said, "This is my stuff. I can show it."
translation.ko: 고모는 고모 물건이니까 봐도 된다고 했어요

translation.en: You have enough money to go in there, into that place.
translation.ko: 거기 들어갈 돈 충분하잖아요 그 요양원요

translation.en: You have more than enough money without the house...
translation.ko: 들어가고도 남을 만큼 있던데요? 집 안 팔고도요

translation.en: over a million dollars!
What is the problem?
Why I ever would've said that is beyond me, frankly.
translation.ko: 내가 왜 그런 말을 했는지 나도 모르겠다

translation.en: [Terry] I can't believe it either, but she said, I think, she's sorry.
Isn't this stupid? I mean, you say stupid things, Diane.
translation.ko: 그냥 바보 같은 소리였어 너도 그럴 때 있을 거 아니야

translation.en: [Terry] Diane, Pat loves you.
-I don't know why she said what she said. -[Pat] I don't either.
translation.ko: - 팻이 왜 그런 말을 했을까 - 나도 모르겠어

translation.en: I don't know what the hell is wrong with me.
I don't need anything like that. I just need her to take care of you.
translation.ko: 전 다 필요 없고, 아줌마가 고모를 잘 챙기기만 바랄 뿐이에요

translation.en: Diana, please.
I can't believe that you feel this way about me, Diane.
translation.ko: 네가 나한테 그런 마음이라니 기가 막히는구나

translation.en: For God's sake...
[Diana] You know what the most important thing to me is?
translation.ko: 저한테 제일 중요한 게 뭔지 아세요?

translation.en: I watch you with Auntie Terry, and it's a beautiful thing.
translation.ko: 아줌마랑 고모 두 분 모습 정말 보기 좋아요

translation.en: The way you treat Auntie Terry is just like a piece of gold.
translation.ko: 테리 고모한테도 더할 수 없이 잘하시죠

translation.en: And that's all I care about,
and I don't care if you care about me. As long as you care about her...
translation.ko: 날 좋아하는 건 바라지도 않아요 고모한테만 잘하시면 돼요

translation.en: Listen, will you stop this?
Stop it! Because I do love you, and I care about you.
translation.ko: 그런 말 하지 마 내가 널 얼마나 사랑하고 아끼는데

translation.en: -Just take care of Auntie Terry. -Now listen!
translation.ko: - 고모나 잘 돌보시라고요 - 내 말 들어

translation.en: Now you stop this crazy ranting and raving...
If I hadn't heard that last night, I wouldn't be feeling this way.
translation.ko: 어젯밤에 그 말만 안 들었어도 이러진 않았을 거예요

translation.en: Oh, God damn it.
You know that I love you.
[Diana] Then I don't understand the motivation for not telling me
translation.ko: 왜 저한테 말을 안 하시는지 알 수가 없어요

translation.en: so that I can help you get everything organized.
translation.ko: 제가 알아야 두 분이 이사 준비하는 걸 도울 거 아녜요

translation.en: At this point, you've got to let me in a little bit, anyway.
translation.ko: 지금 같을 때는 좀이라도 저한테 마음을 열어주세요

translation.en: I just want in a little bit.
-I just want to make sure you're okay. -[Pat] All the way. All the way, Diane.
translation.ko: - 두 분 편하시길 바랄 뿐이에요 - 얼마든지 열고말고

translation.en: That's all I want.
-[Terry] You have a headache, Pat? -No.
I have a heartache.
I feel very sad.
-[Terry] Hmm? -I said I feel very sad.
-[Marlene] Dishes we'll take to Habitat. -[Pat] Yeah. Yeah
translation.ko: - 이 접시들은 우리가 가져갈게요 - 그렇게 해

translation.en: That's a good one.
Bell? Terry, you want the bell?
Yeah, I like that.
[Marlene] Silverware you want to keep, or you want to give away?
[Pat] Beautiful, isn't it? I wonder what it's worth.
-Bookcase is going. -[Pat] Yep. Yep.
Dresser's going.
And these pictures are all gonna go, right?
[Terry] Yeah.
[Pat] Up, up, up. That's a girl.
I don't know what to do with this ball.
Throw it in the garbage.
I'm not throwing it in the garbage. It's a brand new ball.
translation.ko: 이걸 어떻게 버려? 한 번도 안 쓴 건데

translation.en: I threw out 110 books.
Everything's so dirty.
All right.
[Terry] Peoria Redwings.
-[Diana] Bend your knees. -Yeah, you can.
-[man] This is going? -No.
It's funny. Look at-- Look at all these pictures.
Women and gay guys.
This is all her baseball friends.
Auntie Terry's going to be thrilled to see these pictures.
translation.ko: 고모가 이 사진들 보면 정말 좋아하시겠어요

translation.en: Pictures of their travels and their friends and...
translation.ko: 여행지에서 찍은 사진들 친구들이랑 찍은 사진들...

translation.en: And I don't even know who these people are.
These people.
They have a whole other family besides us.
translation.ko: 우리는 모르는 다른 가족이 있는 거예요

translation.en: They've had this whole other life.
translation.ko: 우리는 모르는 또 다른 삶을 살아오셨죠

translation.en: [Diana] This is just a bunch of...
[Pat] Oh, my God almighty.
[Diana] ...bunch of stuff here.
Here, Patty, wait.
[Pat] Oh, my gosh.
Did I ever have a tan.
I can't believe how skinny I was.
[Diana] Yeah, you look like Lauren Bacall.
Oh, God, you guys liked taking pictures in bed.
translation.ko: 침대에서 사진 찍는 걸 무척이나 좋아하셨네요

translation.en: [Terry] Oh, my.
-[Diana] Look at this. -[Terry] We were on our way to Cuba.
translation.ko: - 이것 좀 보세요 - 쿠바 갈 때 찍은 거야
